segment.source: Windows Assessment Console
segment.target: Windows Assessment Console

segment.source: Windows Assessment Console
segment.target: Windows Assessment Console

segment.source: Windows Assessment Console
segment.target: Windows Assessment Console

segment.source: The Windows Assessment Console is a GUI that you can use to assess a local computer.
segment.target: The Windows Assessment Console is a GUI that you can use to assess a local computer.

segment.source: You can use it to group assessments and create new jobs, change existing jobs, and view the results that appear after a job runs.
segment.target: You can use it to group assessments and create new jobs, change existing jobs, and view the results that appear after a job runs.

segment.source: The Windows Assessment Console helps you analyze the computer's configuration, find issues, and find recommendations for fixing computer hardware and performance issues.
segment.target: The Windows Assessment Console helps you analyze the computer's configuration, find issues, and find recommendations for fixing computer hardware and performance issues.

segment.source: It helps you track potential improvements for a particular computer or compare the performance and quality of multiple computers.
segment.target: It helps you track potential improvements for a particular computer or compare the performance and quality of multiple computers.

segment.source: You can use the Windows Assessment Console to package a job, load the job on another computer, and run the job there without needing to first install the Windows Assessment Console on that computer.
segment.target: You can use the Windows Assessment Console to package a job, load the job on another computer, and run the job there without needing to first install the Windows Assessment Console on that computer.

segment.source: You can also use the Windows Assessment Console to import job results to the default results library after you run a packaged job on another computer.
segment.target: You can also use the Windows Assessment Console to import job results to the default results library after you run a packaged job on another computer.

segment.source: The Windows Assessment Console and assessments are installed as part of the Windows Assessment Toolkit, which is available in the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (Windows ADK).
segment.target: The Windows Assessment Console and assessments are installed as part of the Windows Assessment Toolkit, which is available in the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (Windows ADK).

segment.source: The Windows Performance Toolkit is also available in the Windows ADK.
segment.target: The Windows Performance Toolkit is also available in the Windows ADK.

segment.source: When the Windows Performance Toolkit is installed, you can analyze trace files to find the source of issues that you found by using the Windows Assessment Console.
segment.target: When the Windows Performance Toolkit is installed, you can analyze trace files to find the source of issues that you found by using the Windows Assessment Console.

segment.source: For more information, see Windows Performance Toolkit.
segment.target: For more information, see Windows Performance Toolkit.

segment.target: Windows Assessment Console common scenarios

segment.target: Create jobs that have multiple assessments, compare results, and package jobs to run on other computers.
